SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

lia.Monitor.modules
Class XDRUtils

java.lang.Object
  lia.Monitor.modules.XDRUtils
public class XDRUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Util functions to decode/encode XDR base types. Based on RFC 1832.

Understands the following formats: 

           (MSB)                   (LSB)
         +-------+-------+-------+-------+
         | zero  | zero  | zero  | byte  |                        BYTE
         +-------+-------+-------+-------+
         <------------32 bits------------>



           (MSB)                   (LSB)
         +-------+-------+-------+-------+
         |byte 0 |byte 1 |byte 2 |byte 3 |                      INTEGER
         +-------+-------+-------+-------+
         <------------32 bits------------>



        (MSB)                                                   (LSB)
      +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+
      |byte 0 |byte 1 |byte 2 |byte 3 |byte 4 |byte 5 |byte 6 |byte 7 |
      +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+
      <----------------------------64 bits---------------------------->
                                                          HYPER INTEGER


         +------+------+------+------+------+------+------+------+
         |byte 0|byte 1|byte 2|byte 3|byte 4|byte 5|byte 6|byte 7|
         S|    E   |                    F                        |
         +------+------+------+------+------+------+------+------+
         1|<--11-->|<-----------------52 bits------------------->|
         <-----------------------64 bits------------------------->
                                        DOUBLE-PRECISION FLOATING-POINT


            0     1     2     3     4     5   ...
         +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+...+-----+-----+...+-----+
         |        length n       |byte0|byte1|...| n-1 |  0  |...|  0  |
         +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+...+-----+-----+...+-----+
         |<-------4 bytes------->|<------n bytes------>|<---r bytes--->|
                                 |<----n+r (where (n+r) mod 4 = 0)---->|
                                                  VARIABLE-LENGTH OPAQUE


            0     1     2     3     4     5   ...
         +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+...+-----+-----+...+-----+
         |        length n       |byte0|byte1|...| n-1 |  0  |...|  0  |
         +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+...+-----+-----+...+-----+
         |<-------4 bytes------->|<------n bytes------>|<---r bytes--->|
                                 |<----n+r (where (n+r) mod 4 = 0)---->|
                                                                  STRING
enum is the same as integer, boolean is the same as enum { FALSE = 0, TRUE = 1 }.

Version:
$Id: XDRUtils.html,v 1.1.1.1 2003-10-21 09:10:56 ramiro Exp $

encodeUint8

public static final void encodeUint8(byte value,
                                     byte[] buf,
                                     int offset)
Encode an 8bit unsigned integer into a byte array starting at an offset into the array.

Parameters:
value - value to encode into the array.
buf - 4 bytes to store the encoded value.
offset - position in buf to place the encoded value.

encodeEnum

public static final void encodeEnum(int value,
                                    byte[] buf,
                                    int offset)
Encode an enum into a byte array starting at an offset into the array. Packet types are encoded as XDR enums in Elvin4.

Parameters:
value - value to encode into the array.
buf - 4 bytes to store the encoded value.
offset - position in buf to place encoded value.

                                   int offset)
Decode an enum from a byte array starting at an offset into the array. Packet types are encoded as XDR enums in Elvin4.

Parameters:
data - 4 bytes to be converted into an enum.
offset - position in data to start decoding from.
Returns:
decoded enum/type.

encodeReal64

public static final void encodeReal64(double value,
                                      byte[] buf,
                                      int offset)
Encode a single precision float into a byte array starting at an offset into the array. java.lang.Double has methods for converting from a long to IEEE 754 floats as used in XDR.

Parameters:
value - value to encode into the array.
buf - 8 bytes to store the encoded value.
offset - position in buf to place encoded value.

decodeReal64

public static final double decodeReal64(byte[] data,
                                        int offset)
Decode a single precision float from a byte array starting at an offset into the array. java.lang.Double has methods for converting from a long to IEEE 754 floats as used in XDR.

Parameters:
data - 8 bytes to be converted into a single precision float.
offset - position in data to start decoding from.
Returns:
decoded float.

                                     byte[] buf,
                                     int offset)
Encode an opaque sequence of bytes starting at an offset into the array.

Parameters:
value - value to encode into the array.

Returns:
the total length of the marshalled data.

decodeOpaque

public static final byte[] decodeOpaque(byte[] data,
                                        int offset)
Decode an opaque. Data must begin with a 4-byte int indicating length to decode.

Parameters:
data - bytes to be converted into a byte array.
Returns:
decoded array.

stringLength

public static final int stringLength(java.lang.String value)
Calculate the length of a string when encoded.

Parameters:
value - value to calculate the encoded length.
Returns:
the length of string as UTF-8. No padding, no length prepended.

encodeString

public static final int encodeString(java.lang.String value,
                                     byte[] buf,
                                     int offset)
Encode a Java String into a UTF-8 sequence starting at an offset into the array. 0x0000 - 0x007F is one byte 0x0080 - 0x07FF is two bytes 0x0800 - 0xFFFF is three bytes

Parameters:
value - value to encode into the array.
buf - a buffer to store the encoded value.
offset - position in buf to place encoded value.
Returns:
the total length of the marshalled data.

decodeString

public static final java.lang.String decodeString(byte[] data,
                                                  int offset)
Decode a string in UTF-8 format starting at an offset into the array. Data must begin with a 4-byte int indicating length to decode.

Parameters:
data - bytes to be converted into a single precision float.
offset - position in data to start decoding from.
Returns:
decoded string.
